raw_text:
Endnotes, Annex 50
3
20
Reuters, “ Bosnian Army Readies Attack on Donji Vakuf " by Kurt
Schork , 8 November 1994 .
2 Reuters, “ Belgrade Concerned Over Bosnia War Escalation " by Jovan
Kovacic , 27 June 1994.
3 At the time known as the 370th Donji Vakuf Mountain Brigade,
previously of the ARBiH 3rd Corps.
* At the time known as the 307th Bugojno Mountain Brigade,
previously of the ARBiH 3rd Corps.
At the time known as the 27th Krajina Mountain Brigade, previously
of the ARBiH 3rd Corps.
6 At the time known as the 305th Jajce Mountain Brigade, previously of
the ARBiH 3rd Corps.
? At the timeknown as the 306th Mountain Brigade, previously of the
ARBiH 3rd Corps.
8 The 6th and 5th Battalions/1st Novigrad Infantry Brigade each
undertook one tour of duty in the line during the year, attached to the
Ilth Mrkonjic Light Infantry Brigade . A VRS journal article notes that
personnel from Sanski Most ( 6th Sanske Infantry Brigade ), Gradiska,
( 1st Gradiska Light Infantry Brigade ) , Knezevo ( 22nd Infantry
Brigade ), Banja Luka ( Ist -4th Banja Luka Light Infantry Brigades or
16th Krajina Motorized Brigade ), Celinac ( 1st Celinac Light Infantry
Brigade ), Laktasi ( 1st Laktasi Light Infantry Brigade), and Prijedor
( 43rd Prijedor Motorized Brigade) all served in the " Srbobran " sector.
The brigades from these towns probably contributed at least one
company-sized unit each to form composite units for attachment to the
30th Division . Nedeljko Rudic, “ The Gates to the Heart of Krajina Are
Sealed on the Srbobran Battlefield: Krajina is Defended Here ,” Krajiski
Vojnik 15 Nov 1994, pp . 22-23 , an article on the 11th Mrkonjic Grad
Light Infantry Brigade .
VRS military journal articles ( plus one Bosnian Muslim article on a
VRS unit ) covering the Donji Vakuf battles in 1994 include:
Nedeljko Rudic, “ Enemy Offensive Stopped, ” Krajiski Vojnik
June 1994 , p. 23 .
Milka Tosic, “ The Striking Fist, ” Krajiski Vojnik June 1994 , p . 52 ,
an article on the 1st Military Police Battalion .
Nedeljko Rudic , “ The Gates to the Heart of Krajina Are Sealed on the
Srbobran Battlefield : Krajina is Defended Here,” Krajiski Vojnik
15 Nov 1994 , pp. 22-23 , an article on the 11th Mrkonjic Grad Light
Infantry Brigade .
Dzemal Sefer, “ Krajiski Osvetnica Su Vratili Vlasima Dio Duga !"
Travnik Bosnjak 21 November 1995 , p. 21 , an article on the VRS
1st Novigrad Brigade.
10 Sarajevo Radio, 16 March 1994. FBIS Vienna AU 1603104794,
1610472 Mar 94 .
" Reuters, “ On Some Bosnian Fronts , No Truce, No Peace" by Laura
Pitter, 18 March 1994 .
12 Sarajevo Radio, 17 March 1994. FBIS Vienna AU1703102094 ,
171020Z Mar 94 .
13 Belgrade Tanjug, 19 March 1994. FBIS London LD 1903214994,
1921492 Mar 94 .
14 Belgrade Tanjug, 21 March 1994. FBIS London LD2103202894 ,
212028Z Mar 94 .
Sarajevo Radio, 22 March 1994. FBIS Vienna AU2203191694 ,
2219167 Mar 94.
16 Sarajevo Radio, 2 April 1994. FBIS London LD0204175994,
0217592 Apr 94 .
17 Belgrade Tanjug, 4 April 1994. FBIS London LD0404091794,
0409172 Apr 94.
18 Belgrade Tanjug, 6 April 1994. FBIS London LD0604155794,
0615572 Apr 94 .
19 Nedeljko Rudic , “The Gates to the Heart of Krajina Are Sealed on
the Srbobran Battlefield: Krajina is Defended Here,” Krajiski Vojnik
15 Nov 1994 , pp . 22-23 , an article on the 11th Mrkonjic Grad Light
Infantry Brigade ; Paris AFP, 31 May 1994. FBIS Vienna
AU3105114494 311144Z May 94 ; Pale Srpski Radio - Televizija
31 May 1994 FBIS London LD3105150294 3115027 May 94.
Belgrade Radio, 5 June 1994. FBIS Vienna AU0506143294,
051432Z June 94 .
21 Belgrade Radio, 11 June 1994. FBIS Vienna AU1106152094,
1115202 June 94.
22 Zagreb Vecernji List, Interview with General Rasim Delic . Com
mander of the General Staff of the Supreme Command of the Bosnia
Herzegovina Army, “We Are Prepared For Launching Offensives " by
Slobodan Lovrenovic, 26 June 1994. FBIS Vienna AU0107085594,
0108552 Jul 94.
23 Sarajevo Radio, 22 July 1994. FBIS Vienna AU2207202094,
222020 Jul 94 .
24 Sarajevo Radio, 19 October 1994. FBIS London LD1910221594,
1922157 Oct 94 .
25 Reuters, “ U.N. Running Out of Fuel Under Bosnian Serb Ban " by
Kurt Schork , 19 October 1994 .
26 Sarajevo Radio, 27 October 1994. FBIS Vienna AU2710191194,
2719112 Oct 94.
27 Belgrade Tanjug, 4 October 1994. FBIS London LD0411161194,
041611Z Nov 94 .
28 Reuters, “ Bosnians Plan Fresh Offensives — U.N . " by Sean Maguire,
7 November 1994 .
29 Reuters, “Serbs Hit New Bombardment in Bosnia " by Sean Maguire,
7 November 1994 .
30 Reuters, “ Bosnian Muslims, Croats Pound Serbs Around Kupres" by
Kurt Schork, 7 November 1994.
31Reuters, " Bosnian Serbs Said Attacking Croat Troops,"
14 November 1994.
32 Reuters , “ Bosnian Army Attacks in Central Bosnia , "
16 November 1994 .
33 Paris AFP, 16 November 1994. FBIS Vienna AU1611100594 ,
1610052 Nov 94 .
Belgrade Tanjug, 20 November 1994. FBIS London LD2011172894,
201728Z Nov 94 .
35 Reuters , “ Croat -Muslim Alliance Scores First Victory" by Kurt
Schork , 10 November 1994.
36 Reuters, " Croats Supplying Arms to Bosnian Army - Commander "
by Kurt Schork , 6 November 1994.
37 Reuters , “ Bosnian Muslims , Croats Pound Serbs Around Kupres" by
Kurt Schork, 7 November 1994.
38 Reuters , “ Bosnian Army Readies Attack on Donji Vakuf" by Kurt
Schork , 8 November 1994.
39 Reuters , “ Bosnian Army Readies Attack on Donji Vakuf" by Kurt
